@system wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:6, topic:293122”]What I did with my first real useful program, which still isn’t finished…, is just look at different kinds of things, and think: WTF is this POS, i wanna improve it somehow. Then l2doit and ??? and profit![/quote]dam. i see we hev heckers.

@topic: Make a GUI that stores people’s information and is sorted by their name. Store the information in a .ini or .cfg file. Or, if you want to get real sexy, make a class that implements XMLWriter and store the information in an XML file.

item.title: My (2nd) Java Program
item.dc:creator: @degenerate degenerate
item.description:
@degenerate wrote:

I already made a calculator :). I guess I should try making it into a GUI… at the moment, it seems rather primitive.

What it does is, it asks you for the type of equation you want, so, for example, you can type “add” for an addition equation. Then, it asks you for the 1st and 2nd numbers. Then it prints out the result.

item.title: My (2nd) Java Program
item.dc:creator: @degenerate degenerate
item.description:
@degenerate wrote:

import java.util.Random;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class UncreativeProgram{
	public static void main(String[] args){
	
		System.out.println("Welcome to UncreativeProgram.");

		Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
		Random random = new Random();
	
		while(true){			
			int ran = random.nextInt(3);

			System.out.println("Please enter a question, or type 'exit' to exit.");
	
			String s = scanner.nextLine();
			
			if(s.equalsIgnoreCase("exit")){
				System.out.println("UncreativeProgram will now exit.");
				break;
			}
			else{
	
				switch(ran){
					case 0: System.out.println("@");
						break;
					case 1: System.out.println("$");
						break;
					case 2: System.out.println("0");
						break;
					default: System.out.println("OH NOES AN ERROR!");
						break;
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

As you can see, I am very new to Java programming.

Read full topic
